news.title: Trump hails meeting with Putin as 'productive' after talks over Ukraine fail to reach a breakthrough
news.summary: Trump: "There's no deal until there's a deal" following Friday meeting with Obama. Trump says he will continue to meet with Obama until a deal is reached.

news.title: OpenAI in talks to sell around $6 billion in stock at roughly $500 billion valuation
news.summary: The talks are still in early stages and the details could change. The talks between the two sides are expected to continue for a few more months.

news.title: Samsung taking market share from Apple in U.S. as foldable phones gain momentum
news.summary: Samsung introduced two folding phones in July that are garnering praise on social media. Samsung is putting pressure on Apple to deliver new types of iPhones.

news.title: Tech IPOs are roaring after 'years of Prohibition' — it may be too good
news.summary: Bullish's IPO this week is another sign that the market is swinging wide open after a prolonged dry spell. Bullish will go public with a public offering of common stock.

news.title: Engine Capital takes a stake in Avantor. Activist sees several ways to create value
news.summary: Avantor's underperformance is a consequence of self-inflicted mistakes, says Engine. Engine believes that Avantor has a flawed leadership team and framework.

news.title: ‘I’ve been kept in poverty’: Do I take a $70K job at 74 and lose my Section 8 housing allowance?
news.summary: “After the age of 50, I really only had sporadic contract work and I had to sell my house,” he says.

news.title: Inflation alarm bells went off again and prices are rising. Just how bad is it going to get?
news.summary: The biggest increase in wholesale prices in three and a half years stunned Wall Street. But is tariff-related inflation really set to soar? The proof is far from ironclad.

news.title: ‘I’m tired of corporate America’: My wife and I have $1.65 million. I’m 61. Can I retire already?
news.summary: “My annual income is $108,000,” she says. “I’m not rich, but I’ve got a good life.”

news.title: Why nearly 7 in 10 new college grads are looking for jobs close to family
news.summary: Gen Z college graduates are prioritizing work-life balance and saving money when selecting their first job. Gen Z college grads are prioritising work- life balance and savings when selecting a job.

news.title: Getting married when you’re older can be a financial minefield. How to protect yourself.
news.summary: When retirees tie the knot, prenups really matter. Skip them at your peril, experts say. "Prenups are a big part of the deal when you're getting married," says one expert.
